verses.verse: And when the people<WH5971> saw<WH7200> that Moses<WH4872> delayed<WH954> to come down<WH3381> out of the mount<WH2022>, the people<WH5971> gathered themselves together<WH6950> unto Aaron<WH175>, and said<WH559> unto him, Up<WH6965>, make<WH6213> us gods<WH430>, which shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> us; for as for this Moses<WH4872>, the man<WH376> that brought<WH5927> us up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, we wot<WH3045> not what is become of him.

And Aaron<WH175> said<WH559> unto them, Break off<WH6561> the golden<WH2091> earrings<WH5141>, which are in the ears<WH241> of your wives<WH802>, of your sons<WH1121>, and of your daughters<WH1323>, and bring<WH935> them unto me.
And all the people<WH5971> brake off<WH6561> the golden<WH2091> earrings<WH5141> which were in their ears<WH241>, and brought<WH935> them unto Aaron<WH175>.

And he received<WH3947> them at their hand<WH3027>, and fashioned<WH6696> it with a graving tool<WH2747>, after he had made<WH6213> it a molten<WH4541> calf<WH5695>: and they said<WH559>, These be thy gods<WH430>, O Israel<WH3478>, which brought<WH5927> thee up out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And when Aaron<WH175> saw<WH7200> it, he built<WH1129> an altar<WH4196> before<WH6440> it; and Aaron<WH175> made proclamation<WH7121>, and said<WH559>, To morrow<WH4279> is a feast<WH2282> to the LORD<WH3068>.

And they rose up early<WH7925> on the morrow<WH4283>, and offered<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930>, and brought<WH5066> peace offerings<WH8002>; and the people<WH5971> sat<WH3427> down to eat<WH398> and to drink<WH8354>, and rose up<WH6965> to play<WH6711>.

¶ And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, Go<WH3212>, get thee down<WH3381>; for thy people<WH5971>, which thou broughtest<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, have corrupted<WH7843> themselves:

They have turned<WH5493> aside quickly<WH4118> out of the way<WH1870> which I commanded<WH6680> them: they have made<WH6213> them a molten<WH4541> calf<WH5695>, and have worshipped<WH7812> it, and have sacrificed<WH2076> thereunto, and said<WH559>, These be thy gods<WH430>, O Israel<WH3478>, which have brought thee up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, I have seen<WH7200> this people<WH5971>, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked<WH7186><WH6203> people<WH5971>:
Now therefore let me alone<WH3240>, that my wrath<WH639> may wax hot<WH2734> against them, and that I may consume<WH3615> them: and I will make<WH6213> of thee a great<WH1419> nation<WH1471>.

And Moses<WH4872> besought<WH2470><WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> his God<WH430>, and said<WH559>, LORD<WH3068>, why doth thy wrath<WH639> wax hot<WH2734> against thy people<WH5971>, which thou hast brought forth<WH3318> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> with great<WH1419> power<WH3581>, and with a mighty<WH2389> hand<WH3027>?

Wherefore should the Egyptians<WH4714> speak<WH559>, and say<WH559>, For mischief<WH7451> did he bring<WH3318> them out, to slay<WH2026> them in the mountains<WH2022>, and to consume<WH3615> them from the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>? Turn<WH7725> from thy fierce<WH2740> wrath<WH639>, and repent<WH5162> of this evil<WH7451> against thy people<WH5971>.

Remember<WH2142> Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Israel<WH3478>, thy servants<WH5650>, to whom thou swarest<WH7650> by thine own self, and saidst<WH1696> unto them, I will multiply<WH7235> your seed<WH2233> as the stars<WH3556> of heaven<WH8064>, and all this land<WH776> that I have spoken<WH559> of will I give<WH5414> unto your seed<WH2233>, and they shall inherit<WH5157> it for ever<WH5769>.
And the LORD<WH3068> repented<WH5162> of the evil<WH7451> which he thought<WH1696> to do<WH6213> unto his people<WH5971>.

¶ And Moses<WH4872> turned<WH6437>, and went down<WH3381> from the mount<WH2022>, and the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of the testimony<WH5715> were in his hand<WH3027>: the tables<WH3871> were written<WH3789> on both<WH8147> their sides<WH5676>; on the one side and on the other were they written<WH3789>.
And the tables<WH3871> were the work<WH4639> of God<WH430>, and the writing<WH4385> was the writing<WH4385> of God<WH430>, graven<WH2801> upon the tables<WH3871>.
And when Joshua<WH3091> heard<WH8085> the noise<WH6963> of the people<WH5971> as they shouted<WH7452>, he said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, There is a noise<WH6963> of war<WH4421> in the camp<WH4264>.

And he said<WH559>, It is not the voice<WH6963> of them that shout<WH6030> for mastery<WH1369>, neither is it the voice<WH6963> of them that cry<WH6030> for being overcome<WH2476>: but the noise<WH6963> of them that sing<WH6031> do I hear<WH8085>.

¶ And it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh<WH7126> unto the camp<WH4264>, that he saw<WH7200> the calf<WH5695>, and the dancing<WH4246>: and Moses'<WH4872> anger<WH639> waxed hot<WH2734>, and he cast<WH7993> the tables<WH3871> out of his hands<WH3027>, and brake<WH7665> them beneath<WH8478> the mount<WH2022>.

And he took<WH3947> the calf<WH5695> which they had made<WH6213>, and burnt<WH8313> it in the fire<WH784>, and ground<WH2912> it to powder<WH1854>, and strawed<WH2219> it upon<WH6440> the water<WH4325>, and made the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> drink<WH8248> of it.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto Aaron<WH175>, What did<WH6213> this people<WH5971> unto thee, that thou hast brought<WH935> so great<WH1419> a sin<WH2401> upon them?
And Aaron<WH175> said<WH559>, Let not the anger<WH639> of my lord<WH113> wax hot<WH2734>: thou knowest<WH3045> the people<WH5971>, that they are set on mischief<WH7451>.

For they said<WH559> unto me, Make<WH6213> us gods<WH430>, which shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> us: for as for this Moses<WH4872>, the man<WH376> that brought us up<WH5927> out of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, we wot<WH3045> not what is become of him.

And I said<WH559> unto them, Whosoever hath any gold<WH2091>, let them break<WH6561> it off. So they gave<WH5414> it me: then I cast<WH7993> it into the fire<WH784>, and there came out<WH3318> this calf<WH5695>.
¶ And when Moses<WH4872> saw<WH7200> that the people<WH5971> were naked<WH6544>; (for Aaron<WH175> had made them naked<WH6544> unto their shame<WH8103> among their enemies<WH6965>:)

Then Moses<WH4872> stood<WH5975> in the gate<WH8179> of the camp<WH4264>, and said<WH559>, Who is on the LORD's<WH3068> side? let him come unto me. And all the sons<WH1121> of Levi<WH3878> gathered<WH622> themselves together unto him.

And he said<WH559> unto them, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, Put<WH7760> every man<WH376> his sword<WH2719> by his side<WH3409>, and go<WH5674> in and out<WH7725> from gate<WH8179> to gate<WH8179> throughout the camp<WH4264>, and slay<WH2026> every man<WH376> his brother<WH251>, and every man<WH376> his companion<WH7453>, and every man<WH376> his neighbour<WH7138>.

And the children<WH1121> of Levi<WH3878> did<WH6213> according to the word<WH1697> of Moses<WH4872>: and there fell<WH5307> of the people<WH5971> that day<WH3117> about three<WH7969> thousand<WH505> men<WH376>.

For Moses<WH4872> had said<WH559>, Consecrate yourselves<WH4390><WH3027> to day<WH3117> to the LORD<WH3068>, even<WH3588> every man<WH376> upon his son<WH1121>, and upon his brother<WH251>; that he may bestow<WH5414> upon you a blessing<WH1293> this day<WH3117>.

¶ And it came to pass on the morrow<WH4283>, that Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto the people<WH5971>, Ye have sinned<WH2398> a great<WH1419> sin<WH2401>: and now I will go up<WH5927> unto the LORD<WH3068>; peradventure<WH194> I shall make an atonement<WH3722> for<WH1157> your sin<WH2403>.

And Moses<WH4872> returned<WH7725> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, Oh<WH577>, this people<WH5971> have sinned<WH2398> a great<WH1419> sin<WH2401>, and have made<WH6213> them gods<WH430> of gold<WH2091>.
Yet now, if thou wilt forgive<WH5375> their sin<WH2403>—; and if not, blot<WH4229> me, I pray thee, out of thy book<WH5612> which thou hast written<WH3789>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Whosoever<WH834> hath sinned<WH2398> against me, him will I blot out<WH4229> of my book<WH5612>.

Therefore now go<WH3212>, lead<WH5148> the people<WH5971> unto the place of which I have spoken<WH1696> unto thee: behold, mine Angel<WH4397> shall go<WH3212> before<WH6440> thee: nevertheless in the day<WH3117> when I visit<WH6485> I will visit<WH6485> their sin<WH2403> upon them.
And the LORD<WH3068> plagued<WH5062> the people<WH5971>, because<WH834> they made<WH6213> the calf<WH5695>, which<WH834> Aaron<WH175> made<WH6213>.
